commit_message:
Add tracepath commands to the AIO

The tracepath command is sometimes missing from the gate image.
This PR simply makes sure that the packages for tracepath are
installed so that we get the needed data in the gate at all times.

Change-Id: I863f6ea47d40154c7c3510c42efa7beab34327bf
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update devref for this.

Needed-By: Iea42a0525b2c5a5cdbf8604eb23a6e7b029f6b48
Change-Id: Ie9bae659077dbe299eea131572117036065bdccf
(cherry picked from commit d60dffc6bef4d2de32b9509a62f894136c434c3c)

commit_message:
General tidy of charm ready for release

Switch functional tests to use cephx; Tests should really
align to default configuration, which is to have cephx
enabled for a deployment.

Updated README to be a little simpler, and default to
Xenial rather than Trusty.

Added proper Ceph icon.

Drop layer dependency on ceph-base - it brings in loads
of stuff we don't need.

Tidy config.yaml to drop duplicate ceph-public-network.

Depends-On: Ied8d5306ab77b8e68efd0a8e5df4087a067f0367
Change-Id: I4ab5438db93ae613e9232ca42df1c23614e212e6

Change-Id: I9a77eeb410f59feda5ee84429eae8895ae3f3c26

commit_message:
Pass-in empty array uuid filter to server list

If there are no VMs running on the compute node, the given instance_uuids
will be an empty array. This should be added as a filter, otherwise, the
entire list of instances will be returned.

Change-Id: I9a77eeb410f59feda5ee84429eae8895ae3f3c26
Closes-Bug: #1660293
(cherry picked from commit 79c4b36315b7cc31fdf92c982ebea681279b579a)

subject: Respond udp and tcp to router port with icmp unreachable message
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 09:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/common/icmp_error_generator.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l3_proactive_app.py'], 'message': 'Respond udp and tcp to router port with icmp unreachable message

Depending on whether running l3 agent, the router interface could be
either concrete or virtual.

A concrete router interface will have ovs port to respond the various
IP connection. We can just direct packets to the ovs port.

A virtual router interface is a logic concept, but vms are not aware
of that. The icmp respondor will respond icmp echo request, while this
patch add udp and tcp respondor with the reply of icmp unreachable
message. This is the same as the concrete port, and can make the traceroute
to virtual router interface work.

Change-Id: I73cfc401e153000d9565ab8331ed00fb0be8494c
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
'}]
commit_message:
Respond udp and tcp to router port with icmp unreachable message

Depending on whether running l3 agent, the router interface could be
either concrete or virtual.

A concrete router interface will have ovs port to respond the various
IP connection. We can just direct packets to the ovs port.

A virtual router interface is a logic concept, but vms are not aware
of that. The icmp respondor will respond icmp echo request, while this
patch add udp and tcp respondor with the reply of icmp unreachable
message. This is the same as the concrete port, and can make the traceroute
to virtual router interface work.

Change-Id: I73cfc401e153000d9565ab8331ed00fb0be8494c
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support

commit_message:
Add unique key to router

We are handling all routers in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE, adding an
identification to distinguish packets that belongs to different
routers would be helpful. It also makes it possible to optimize
the flow rules for router.

Change-Id: I867193665fea74bc44d0429789328a4bd0f74dea
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
Partial-Bug: #1635509

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-11 10:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/common/utils.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add H233 to pep8 check

H233 will report error when print is used as operator.
print operator has been removed in py3. We should add H233 check

We can launch the check for future code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396915/

commit_message:
Add H233 to pep8 check

H233 will report error when print is used as operator.
print operator has been removed in py3. We should add H233 check
as py3 is in the support list. This problem was first found at [1]
We can launch the check for future code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396915/

Change-Id: I4fef99c24941f048fd61a808e03869bacd30c001
Co-Authored-By: Wang Jian <wangjian38@huawei.com>
Partial-Bug: #1663864

subject: Modify metadata of packet when route
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 13:16:31.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l3_app.py'], 'message': 'Modify metadata of packet when route

After routing, the packet will traverse in the destination network.
It is necessary to change the packet metadata when route, so that the
security group(or connection tracker) can track the state of
connection in correct zone.

Change-Id: I7b23eee112ef10f0fc636f39ed96556ee6fb796e
Closes-Bug: #1663509
'}]
commit_message:
Modify metadata of packet when route

After routing, the packet will traverse in the destination network.
It is necessary to change the packet metadata when route, so that the
security group(or connection tracker) can track the state of
connection in correct zone.

Change-Id: I7b23eee112ef10f0fc636f39ed96556ee6fb796e
Closes-Bug: #1663509

subject: Add -nv coverage jobs, convert existing non-voting tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-13 03:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add -nv coverage jobs, convert existing non-voting tests

We currently have quite a few non-voting regexes for coverage jobs
which we can remove by just calling -nv suffixed jobs.

(There's probably an argument that all coverage jobs should be
non-voting, since they replicate the py testing jobs just with the
coverage wrapper.  But one thing at a time :).

Change-Id: I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc
"}]
commit_message:
Add -nv coverage jobs, convert existing non-voting tests

We currently have quite a few non-voting regexes for coverage jobs
which we can remove by just calling -nv suffixed jobs.

(There's probably an argument that all coverage jobs should be
non-voting, since they replicate the py testing jobs just with the
coverage wrapper.  But one thing at a time :).

Change-Id: I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc

subject: Fix devstack colors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-24 18:56:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': "Fix devstack colors

After the patch 'Default use_stderr to False'[1] landed, the
color output from devstack logs does not follow the desired
standard, with differentiation of messages by LOG level, making
debug and tracing errors a nightmare. This brings the colors
to the correct behaviour.

Change-Id: Ie5a30e1c991cbd0aea34d83570e9bc7cc4a80ca2
Closes-bug: #1659077
"}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack colors

After the patch 'Default use_stderr to False'[1] landed, the
color output from devstack logs does not follow the desired
standard, with differentiation of messages by LOG level, making
debug and tracing errors a nightmare. This brings the colors
to the correct behaviour.

Change-Id: Ie5a30e1c991cbd0aea34d83570e9bc7cc4a80ca2
Closes-bug: #1659077

subject: Bring idempotency to swapon
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 16:36:04.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_loopback_swap.yml'], 'message': 'Bring idempotency to swapon

swapon will fail ("swapon failed: Device or resource busy") if run twice
with the same file.

This ensures we test if the swap file is enabled (checking in /proc),
and if not, do the proper actions.

Change-Id: I5461efcd0352f831b2051b95661861bfdcd346af
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043)
'}]
commit_message:
Bring idempotency to swapon

swapon will fail ("swapon failed: Device or resource busy") if run twice
with the same file.

This ensures we test if the swap file is enabled (checking in /proc),
and if not, do the proper actions.

Change-Id: I5461efcd0352f831b2051b95661861bfdcd346af
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(cherry picked from commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 12:16:57.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp'], 'message': 'Ensures $keystone_wsgi_script_path right permissions.

Closes-Bug: 1645299

In the case of more restrictive, system-wide umask setting,
directory $keystone_wsgi_script_path may become inaccessible for
web-server resulting in keystone failures.

Change-Id: I4cdc053bb88da0a7c2604ff0b431de57e24b41eb
'}]
commit_message:
Ensures $keystone_wsgi_script_path right permissions.

Closes-Bug: 1645299

In the case of more restrictive, system-wide umask setting,
directory $keystone_wsgi_script_path may become inaccessible for
web-server resulting in keystone failures.

Change-Id: I4cdc053bb88da0a7c2604ff0b431de57e24b41eb

subject: Get conf files from local git server rather than upstream
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 20:11:36.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/gnocchi_all.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/ceilometer_all.yml'], 'message': 'Get conf files from local git server rather than upstream

Now that gnocchi and ceilometer are pulling conf files from git
repositories rather than storing them in the role, we should ensure we
pull these files from the repo server rather than the upstream
git.openstack.org location when setting up gnocchi and ceilometer.

Change-Id: I26c18826f04bb206767cd5c7f9454f62faa726fa
Depends-On: I86389c1f7643a0634a85f165f62f089a316f040c
'}]
commit_message:
Get conf files from local git server rather than upstream

Now that gnocchi and ceilometer are pulling conf files from git
repositories rather than storing them in the role, we should ensure we
pull these files from the repo server rather than the upstream
git.openstack.org location when setting up gnocchi and ceilometer.

Change-Id: I26c18826f04bb206767cd5c7f9454f62faa726fa
Depends-On: I86389c1f7643a0634a85f165f62f089a316f040c

subject: Expose horizon_disallow_iframe_embed in defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 17:20:21.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml', 'templates/horizon_local_settings.py.j2'], 'message': 'Expose horizon_disallow_iframe_embed in defaults

In order to expose the variable in documentation,
it is defined in defaults and the value is always
templated. The default value is set to the same
as the upstream default.

Change-Id: I3a8785de414a82931b1089f7396b0fbe3b68ae7d
'}]
commit_message:
Expose horizon_disallow_iframe_embed in defaults

In order to expose the variable in documentation,
it is defined in defaults and the value is always
templated. The default value is set to the same
as the upstream default.

Change-Id: I3a8785de414a82931b1089f7396b0fbe3b68ae7d

Due to the situation, that we've already had more that 7000 lines of
code in this file and it contains different test cases, it is
reasonably to divide it into smaller files.

This patch includes test cases that are connected with replication
and failover test cases.

Change-Id: I5c60f17d950161a9d4df0278a5753413268b0175
"}]
commit_message:
[4/11] Refactor test_volume file

Due to the situation, that we've already had more that 7000 lines of
code in this file and it contains different test cases, it is
reasonably to divide it into smaller files.

This patch includes test cases that are connected with replication
and failover test cases.

Change-Id: I5c60f17d950161a9d4df0278a5753413268b0175

commit_message:
Build from source for ansible

Since upper-constraints version bump we should build ansible from
source, where the requirement on Jinja2<2.9 is no longer a
consideration.

commit_message:
Use IPNetworkField defined in OVO

The class IPNetworkField is now built-in in oslo.versionedobjects, we
don't need to define a duplicated class in Neutron.

Change-Id: I513e167bf51a9e7944149f8815a12657b0148998

subject: decouple test events from its base class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 14:43:45.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage_tempest_tests/tests/api/event/test_events.py'], 'message': 'decouple test events from its base class

test event needs only vitrage client and not
all the clients that are created in the base class
this creates problems when running tempest not in
a devstack enviroment for example when trying
to run puppet-openstack-integration

Change-Id: If0e0e1d132463a29d62e1979591484e616ca06d6
'}]
commit_message:
decouple test events from its base class

test event needs only vitrage client and not
all the clients that are created in the base class
this creates problems when running tempest not in
a devstack enviroment for example when trying
to run puppet-openstack-integration

Change-Id: If0e0e1d132463a29d62e1979591484e616ca06d6

commit_message:
Adds in proxy role - Ubuntu 16.04

Building on from the previous commit https://review.openstack.org/427869
this add in a proxy role which sets up the environment and apt in case
this machine is based behind some form of proxy.

Change-Id: I1f2266f6443354aa954438801c0ddc84e78d6994

commit_message:
Adds in network config - removes hardcoded values

172.29 has the potential to conflict with internal addressing schemes.
Rather than have this hard coded these changes are to allow this to be
configured. Variables file has also been added to allow customization of
defined values.

Change-Id: I0b3e68443e7331b02794c3a54478e131d23fd5ec

subject: Always check cmd which does not exist
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-13 01:49:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_rootwrap/tests/test_functional.py', 'oslo_rootwrap/filters.py'], 'message': 'Always check cmd which does not exist

In daemon mode, if run a cmd which does not exist,
it will raise an Exception. But when we install the
cmd later and run cmd, it still raise an Exception.
The only work around right now is to restart the
daemon, with this change, we can avoid restarting
the daemon

Closes-Bug: #1663216
Change-Id: I6f6ff540ed103f0fec329d6264bdac26493c8fad
'}]
commit_message:
Always check cmd which does not exist

In daemon mode, if run a cmd which does not exist,
it will raise an Exception. But when we install the
cmd later and run cmd, it still raise an Exception.
The only work around right now is to restart the
daemon, with this change, we can avoid restarting
the daemon

Closes-Bug: #1663216
Change-Id: I6f6ff540ed103f0fec329d6264bdac26493c8fad

subject: Make placement API endpoint lookup's interface configurable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-13 06:03:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/conf/placement.py'], 'message': "Make placement API endpoint lookup's interface configurable

When getting the keystone endpoint for the placement API, the interface
default's to 'public', as this is the default in keystone. However, in
some deployments it would be more appropriate to have this value
configurable, as we might want to use the internal endpoint, due to the
usage of network isolation in the deployment.

This commit adds an 'os_endpoint_interface' option to the placement API
section of the configuration, which will be used for this purpose. It
defaults to 'public' to keep the functionality that existed before.

Change-Id: I4d4aa8d30ab9e5e7f10ddde6882b617f29a8af9f
Closes-Bug: #1663187
"}]
commit_message:
Make placement API endpoint lookup's interface configurable

When getting the keystone endpoint for the placement API, the interface
default's to 'public', as this is the default in keystone. However, in
some deployments it would be more appropriate to have this value
configurable, as we might want to use the internal endpoint, due to the
usage of network isolation in the deployment.

This commit adds an 'os_endpoint_interface' option to the placement API
section of the configuration, which will be used for this purpose. It
defaults to 'public' to keep the functionality that existed before.

Change-Id: I4d4aa8d30ab9e5e7f10ddde6882b617f29a8af9f
Closes-Bug: #1663187

subject: Move to kubernetes client from python-k8sclient
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-11 00:54:07.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Move to kubernetes client from python-k8sclient

Context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/111021.html

* Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. This is a Kubernetes community project.

* Is the library good code?

  Yes. Same as python-k8sclient it's generated from swagger and patched
  for some failure scenarios.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

  Yes, the library is licensed as Apache 2.0

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No. It's on pypi.

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
  global-requirements.txt?

  Yes in python-k8sclient which is only used and maintained by us. We should
  move to the upstream package instead.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? Which?

  Magnum, Kuryr, Kolla-Kubernetes will need this library.

Change-Id: I72359f2b811392008eb5267812bf343797b1553a
"}]
commit_message:
Move to kubernetes client from python-k8sclient

Context:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-January/111021.html

* Is the library actively maintained?

  Yes. This is a Kubernetes community project.

* Is the library good code?

  Yes. Same as python-k8sclient it's generated from swagger and patched
  for some failure scenarios.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

* Is the library license compatible?

  Yes, the library is licensed as Apache 2.0

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No. It's on pypi.

* Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
  global-requirements.txt?

  Yes in python-k8sclient which is only used and maintained by us. We should
  move to the upstream package instead.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? Which?

  Magnum, Kuryr, Kolla-Kubernetes will need this library.

Change-Id: I72359f2b811392008eb5267812bf343797b1553a

commit_message:
[2/11] Refactor test_volume file

Due to the situation, that we've already had more that 7000 lines of
code in this file and it contains different test cases, it is
reasonably to divide it into smaller files.

This patch includes test cases that are connected with drivers and base
driver test cases.

Change-Id: I8aad2460d587e3211828314d89eccd684a673f00

revisions:

The rack repo has not merged anything since November 2015,
the cerberus repo has not merged anything since December 2015.

Since we're abandoning python-db jobs and cannot push the test-setup.sh
script to them, remove the python-db jobs from both of these repos,
leave only pep8 in there in.

Change-Id: I3357ea9788c1e71a1fce2bc18cbc45e50f24dbe5
"}]
commit_message:
Rack/cerberus: Remove python-db jobs

The rack repo has not merged anything since November 2015,
the cerberus repo has not merged anything since December 2015.

Since we're abandoning python-db jobs and cannot push the test-setup.sh
script to them, remove the python-db jobs from both of these repos,
leave only pep8 in there in.

Change-Id: I3357ea9788c1e71a1fce2bc18cbc45e50f24dbe5

subject: Fixing overcloud stack update failure in interactive mode
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-09 10:34:43.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/package_update.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_update.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_update/test_overcloud_update.py'], 'message': 'Fixing overcloud stack update failure in interactive mode

The interactive update (-i) fails because of parameter mismatch
in PackageUpdateManager. A new parameter stack_fields is added,
it will not be used in the cli update flow, so passing it dummy.
Also cleaned up some of the logs on overcloud update action.

Change-Id: Iddb6ba9b0692b350426c22840fef833123682136
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing overcloud stack update failure in interactive mode

The interactive update (-i) fails because of parameter mismatch
in PackageUpdateManager. A new parameter stack_fields is added,
it will not be used in the cli update flow, so passing it dummy.
Also cleaned up some of the logs on overcloud update action.

Change-Id: Iddb6ba9b0692b350426c22840fef833123682136

commit_message:
Update the purge exception catch

1.ValueError is an ancestor class of ValidationFailed. It
should be removed.
2.Add the unified Exception to avoid 500 internal error.

Change-Id: I5f9d6c9dc0939f2397059534560a2752476706cd

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-16 03:18:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

There are two types of volume_type, it can be an instance of
VolumeType or dictionary, because the cinder api or volume
manager get it by using different database api. When retyping a
volume, the manager gets the new volume_type by using volume_type
id, and the database api converts the qeury result to dictionary.
In other cases, if volume_type is just a part of a volume, we get
it at the same time when getting the volume from database by using
volume_id, and the database api will not convert the result to
dictionary. Thus, in method '_is_replicated_type', these two cases
should be handled respectively, or it may get an incorrect value
for specs.

Change-Id: Ic072c6c511acdbfb32f88ebd2daf45cf3210e5a1
Closes-Bug: #1653917
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: two types of 'volume_type' should be handled respectively.

There are two types of volume_type, it can be an instance of
VolumeType or dictionary, because the cinder api or volume
manager get it by using different database api. When retyping a
volume, the manager gets the new volume_type by using volume_type
id, and the database api converts the qeury result to dictionary.
In other cases, if volume_type is just a part of a volume, we get
it at the same time when getting the volume from database by using
volume_id, and the database api will not convert the result to
dictionary. Thus, in method '_is_replicated_type', these two cases
should be handled respectively, or it may get an incorrect value
for specs.

Change-Id: Ic072c6c511acdbfb32f88ebd2daf45cf3210e5a1
Closes-Bug: #1653917

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-12 02:06:08.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/collectd/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/collectd/templates/collectd.conf.j2', 'ansible/roles/collectd/templates/collectd.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/collectd/tasks/start.yml'], 'message': 'provide a universal collectd template

The default config for collectd is very different between OS distro.
For example, in ubuntu, collectd read config from "/etc/collect/collect.conf.d".
But in centos, collectd read config from "/etc/collect.d"
We need to provide a universal collectd template
to make it convenient for different distros.

Change-Id: Ib82fcbb923cb32dbafce04e1e639a400d59a4365
Closes-Bug: #1652246
'}]
commit_message:
provide a universal collectd template

The default config for collectd is very different between OS distro.
For example, in ubuntu, collectd read config from "/etc/collect/collect.conf.d".
But in centos, collectd read config from "/etc/collect.d"
We need to provide a universal collectd template
to make it convenient for different distros.

Change-Id: Ib82fcbb923cb32dbafce04e1e639a400d59a4365
Closes-Bug: #1652246

commit_message:
Delete the hostmonitor and processmonitor written in bash

Hostmonitor and processmonitor have been rewritten in python.
With this, the hostmonitor and processmonitor written in bash
are no longer needed.
This patch deleted them.

Change-Id: I21b8003de317314701cc017364b442583421f0c3
Implements: bp pythonize-host-and-process-monitor

subject: Move OpenStack-Ansible os_tempest Centos to non-voting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-12 18:57:37.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Move OpenStack-Ansible os_tempest Centos to non-voting

CentOS gates in OSA are taking considerably longer than Xenial gates.
This is causing a large number of timeouts, and is blocking the gate
for roles that have longer gate runs.

We should move the os_tempest role back to non-voting until a more
permanent solution can be achieved.

Change-Id: I2b8b7f2eabd337eb04b5d890449f243012e7b114
'}]
commit_message:
Move OpenStack-Ansible os_tempest Centos to non-voting

CentOS gates in OSA are taking considerably longer than Xenial gates.
This is causing a large number of timeouts, and is blocking the gate
for roles that have longer gate runs.

We should move the os_tempest role back to non-voting until a more
permanent solution can be achieved.

Change-Id: I2b8b7f2eabd337eb04b5d890449f243012e7b114

commit_message:
nova: start compute after keystone endpoints/services

Nova team suggest it to avoid situations where nova-compute don't find
the placement service in the service catalog, which could lead to
compute resource not registred.

Change-Id: I14d7079e3830ca4436780ce690dbee5381a5e454
(cherry picked from commit 7fe3c0e7e4f1e53985131740656f8c179439d532)

commit_message:
Use oslo.db

This commit replaces the openstack.common.db module with oslo.db.

Note that database migration tests in climate/tests/db/migration have
not yet been changed to use test fixtures and helpers from oslo.db.

Change-Id: I706f7a1028617c8e35b989ff11ecdecd62dcd1a3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-08 13:04:23.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': "Run online_data_migrations during minor updates.

We didn't complete the M->N upgrades correctly with a `nova-manage db
online_data_migrations` command before, which might result in a
performance impairment.  So, as a stop-gap-solution we run it here,
which is a noop if there is nothing to do.

Change-Id: I7c8b04c1a0640ce3222d22920f37492c6387759e
Related-Bug: #1656791
"}]
commit_message:
Run online_data_migrations during minor updates.

We didn't complete the M->N upgrades correctly with a `nova-manage db
online_data_migrations` command before, which might result in a
performance impairment.  So, as a stop-gap-solution we run it here,
which is a noop if there is nothing to do.

Change-Id: I7c8b04c1a0640ce3222d22920f37492c6387759e
Related-Bug: #1656791

subject: Fixed typo causing bug in openstack-hosts-setup
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-11 03:48:22.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/openstack-hosts-setup.yml'], 'message': "Fixed typo causing bug in openstack-hosts-setup

The '$' at the end of the dpkg-query command causes it to return 2,
which means python won't be installed even though it should be.

Change-Id: I3937448a419a1f2d6405952e1cd7a4002b8d09af
(cherry picked from commit 56f72ac3d33de2c07bb504ed530294ed7274bd3b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed typo causing bug in openstack-hosts-setup

The '$' at the end of the dpkg-query command causes it to return 2,
which means python won't be installed even though it should be.

Change-Id: I3937448a419a1f2d6405952e1cd7a4002b8d09af
(cherry picked from commit 56f72ac3d33de2c07bb504ed530294ed7274bd3b)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 15:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/nova.pp'], 'message': "nova: start compute after keystone endpoints/services

Nova team suggest it to avoid situations where nova-compute don't find
the placement service in the service catalog, which could lead to
compute resource not registred.

Change-Id: I14d7079e3830ca4436780ce690dbee5381a5e454
"}]
commit_message:
nova: start compute after keystone endpoints/services

Nova team suggest it to avoid situations where nova-compute don't find
the placement service in the service catalog, which could lead to
compute resource not registred.

Change-Id: I14d7079e3830ca4436780ce690dbee5381a5e454

commit_message:
Add failure condition to upgrade test

overall failure rate.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-25 17:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['specs/policy/squads.rst'], 'message': "Create a new squad for Python 3

Porting TripleO projects to support Python 3.5 represents some amount of
work and will require collaboration between folks working on this topic.
Having a squad would help to make this collaboration official and we'll
probably setup some tools (etherpad, meeting, etc) to track the work
done on $topic.

Change-Id: Ia6c67aa1eb2bb9ee19d9442bd22cc456c009a643
"}]
commit_message:
Create a new squad for Python 3

Porting TripleO projects to support Python 3.5 represents some amount of
work and will require collaboration between folks working on this topic.
Having a squad would help to make this collaboration official and we'll
probably setup some tools (etherpad, meeting, etc) to track the work
done on $topic.

Change-Id: Ia6c67aa1eb2bb9ee19d9442bd22cc456c009a643

subject: Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-03 10:46:04.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/rabbitmq_password_change-4fce15c9ebb0e20c.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/rabbitmq.pp'], 'message': "Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update

Rabbitmq Password is set on the fresh deployment, but during
update, if the password is changed, it is modified in all config
files including rabbitmq config. But the rabbitmq connection fails
because the new password is not successful applied to rabbitmq.
Setting the rabbitmq_user will invoke 'rabbitmqctl change_password'.

Scenario: The password change is applied on Step1 when configuring
Rabbitmq. Other services may be updated on different Steps. Till
other services config is updated with new rabbitmq password, and
restarted, the connections will get Access Denied response. It has
cyclic dependency. So the passwords will be changes at Step1 and
once all services are updated, the connections will work as is.

Partial-Bug: #1611704
Change-Id: I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54
"}]
commit_message:
Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update

Rabbitmq Password is set on the fresh deployment, but during
update, if the password is changed, it is modified in all config
files including rabbitmq config. But the rabbitmq connection fails
because the new password is not successful applied to rabbitmq.
Setting the rabbitmq_user will invoke 'rabbitmqctl change_password'.

Scenario: The password change is applied on Step1 when configuring
Rabbitmq. Other services may be updated on different Steps. Till
other services config is updated with new rabbitmq password, and
restarted, the connections will get Access Denied response. It has
cyclic dependency. So the passwords will be changes at Step1 and
once all services are updated, the connections will work as is.

Partial-Bug: #1611704
Change-Id: I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54

subject: Use "Default", "Value" and "DefaultValue" for Heat parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 11:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/stacks/forms.py'], 'message': 'Use "Default", "Value" and "DefaultValue" for Heat parameters

It seems there has been changes in the Heat API, and it no longer
returns the default value for a parameter in the "Default" key, it
has been instead renamed to "DefaultValue" and later to "Value".
This patch makes it use all those key names, whichever exists.

Clases-bug: 1658111
Change-Id: Ia86d8d79fcd48974ffe3fecf21a7153bf2ba6a9a
(cherry picked from commit 39e2bb784c1c0a6f3d87910371aa959cf835d461)
'}]
commit_message:
Use "Default", "Value" and "DefaultValue" for Heat parameters

It seems there has been changes in the Heat API, and it no longer
returns the default value for a parameter in the "Default" key, it
has been instead renamed to "DefaultValue" and later to "Value".
This patch makes it use all those key names, whichever exists.

Clases-bug: 1658111
Change-Id: Ia86d8d79fcd48974ffe3fecf21a7153bf2ba6a9a
(cherry picked from commit 39e2bb784c1c0a6f3d87910371aa959cf835d461)

subject: Fixes problem with kolla-kubernetes 3.0.2 images
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-12 14:44:26.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Fixes problem with kolla-kubernetes 3.0.2 images

The kolla-kubernetes deliverable uses Newton images, however,
the kolla-ansible 4.0.0 deliverable is targeted at Ocata.  In
Ocata, nova requires the placement API implementation.  This
change is transitory until genconfig is no longer required
for kolla-kubernetes to operate.

Change-Id: I1c192a01d91b4f507bafadb53b6abb1efdcdb46c
Closes-Bug: #1663961
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes problem with kolla-kubernetes 3.0.2 images

The kolla-kubernetes deliverable uses Newton images, however,
the kolla-ansible 4.0.0 deliverable is targeted at Ocata.  In
Ocata, nova requires the placement API implementation.  This
change is transitory until genconfig is no longer required
for kolla-kubernetes to operate.

Change-Id: I1c192a01d91b4f507bafadb53b6abb1efdcdb46c
Closes-Bug: #1663961

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-12 14:39:21.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/functional/test_floating_ip.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_limits.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_range_search.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_floating_ip_pool.py', 'shade/tests/functional/base.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_cluster_templates.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_volume.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_server_group.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_volume_type.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_zone.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_stack.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_flavor.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_image.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_recordset.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_volume_backup.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_devstack.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_object.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_compute.py', 'shade/tests/functional/test_security_groups.py'], 'message': 'Rename demo_cloud to user_cloud

The operator cloud is "operator_cloud" which is clear. Even though the
devstack user is called "demo" - the point of the non-operator cloud is
that it's an end-user connection. Rename demo to user to remove any
confusion/ambiguity. (also, it's the same number of letters so pep8
doesn't get borked)

Change-Id: Icfd2dd1687099798ed2cdf9349cc5b7d27dade58
'}]
commit_message:
Rename demo_cloud to user_cloud

The operator cloud is "operator_cloud" which is clear. Even though the
devstack user is called "demo" - the point of the non-operator cloud is
that it's an end-user connection. Rename demo to user to remove any
confusion/ambiguity. (also, it's the same number of letters so pep8
doesn't get borked)

Change-Id: Icfd2dd1687099798ed2cdf9349cc5b7d27dade58

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-12 14:44:26.000000000', 'files': ['tools/setup_gate.sh'], 'message': "Install ansible without upper constraints

Ansible use jinja2 < 2.9, but requirements/upper-constraints.txt
requires jinja2===2.9.5. Installing ansible shouldn't use upper
constraints provides by OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ib37e8d06373a61959b41b8737085d5f001650e42
"}]
commit_message:
Install ansible without upper constraints

Ansible use jinja2 < 2.9, but requirements/upper-constraints.txt
requires jinja2===2.9.5. Installing ansible shouldn't use upper
constraints provides by OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ib37e8d06373a61959b41b8737085d5f001650e42

commit_message:
nova-manage docs: add cells commands prep

This is the first commit in a series to document the nova-manage cells
commands.

This scope of this first commit is limited to cleaning up the section
titles, and removing the hardcoded list of categories as it is prone to
becoming out of date (and is currently not up-to-date).

Change-Id: I59af436fca739de3d4d5033f7b5eb43a8dff287f

commit_message:
Stable/Ocata SHA bump

Coming up to release time, this is a SHA bump to keep everything in
order and make sure we are tracking upstream a bit closer.

Additionally, resolve the group name changes and variable removal from
the os_designate role in patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427810/

Change-Id: I3d598bad538e298e090952d82e388817cf610c21

subject: Don't run tripleo-ci jobs on files that aren't tested
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-06 16:13:30.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Don't run tripleo-ci jobs on files that aren't tested

There are a number of files in the tripleo-ci project that can't be
tested in the gate because they are related to the setup of the
tripleo-ci infrastructure.  Running 7 ovb jobs and 4 multinode jobs
on changes to these files is a waste of resources.

Change-Id: Iec741ac4016eb1c6c12125c3924d01863b4b9e0e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run tripleo-ci jobs on files that aren't tested

There are a number of files in the tripleo-ci project that can't be
tested in the gate because they are related to the setup of the
tripleo-ci infrastructure.  Running 7 ovb jobs and 4 multinode jobs
on changes to these files is a waste of resources.

Change-Id: Iec741ac4016eb1c6c12125c3924d01863b4b9e0e

commit_message:
First keystone test using request_mock

Update and correct issues with shade to support use of request_mock
instead of keystoneclient. This solves issues with the catalog v2,
the discovery.json, and leans on the fixes for the test_create_user_v2.

Change-Id: I78666d44d0a2ff9f013a68c09c76d092fea3a586

commit_message:
Dump and  run puppet for role which are disable_upgrade_deployment true

We wants to run puppet on each role which has the flag
disable_upgrade_deployment to true. It will run after the upgrade
of the role and before running the whole converge step.

Change-Id: Ia85be688d070dfb5b8337e8ef3c4bc439fb6052e

commit_message:
Remove 3DES from ssl_cipher_suite

Triple-DES is a vulnerable cipher and should be disabled by default.

https://sweet32.info/
https://www.openssl.org/blog/blog/2016/08/24/sweet32/

Manual back-port of I3171abf6c630f287653e7d80f4ba3ff1cc8db375

Change-Id: I8a1829082d1971c99a6ae323d4795a2a16f2fe64

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2017-02-07 13:46:58.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_roles.py'], 'message': 'Implied roles API tests

Implied roles is a feature added recently to keystone. It enables the
possibility to have roles implying another roles, this avoids the need
to add specific role assignments to each action a user can take. For
example: if we had the "admin" role implying the "member" role, we
would not need to add entries specifiying the "member" role for a
user that is already "admin".

Change-Id: I81b3fce613c80aad9e80847df5a61ed10887221c
'}]
commit_message:
Implied roles API tests

Implied roles is a feature added recently to keystone. It enables the
possibility to have roles implying another roles, this avoids the need
to add specific role assignments to each action a user can take. For
example: if we had the "admin" role implying the "member" role, we
would not need to add entries specifiying the "member" role for a
user that is already "admin".

Change-Id: I81b3fce613c80aad9e80847df5a61ed10887221c

The Ironic virt driver does not support attach/detach of VIFs (yet)

commit_message:
Handle NotImplementedError in _process_instance_vif_deleted_event

The Ironic virt driver does not support attach/detach of VIFs (yet)
so when Neutron sends an asynchronous event back to Nova that
VIFs were unplugged on instance delete, we do not need to trace
all over the logs when the Ironic driver does not implement
detach_interface().

Change-Id: I6f6533322c1179b3396e56b37c4f3f4228d8da01
Closes-Bug: #1660317

subject: Add rate limiter to icmp handler(DNAT)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-09 11:13:23.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/conf/df_dnat.py', 'dragonflow/controller/dnat_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py', 'dragonflow/tests/common/app_testing_objects.py'], 'message': "Add rate limiter to icmp handler(DNAT)

To support traceroute or its backend network functionality, some icmp
messages are generated or re-processed at local controller. This
provides the possiblity of DDoS attack.

To prevent that, several global rate limters are added. So that the
controller won't be overwhelmed. Global rate limters should be enough,
as icmp works as control message.

Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
"}]
commit_message:
Add rate limiter to icmp handler(DNAT)

To support traceroute or its backend network functionality, some icmp
messages are generated or re-processed at local controller. This
provides the possiblity of DDoS attack.

To prevent that, several global rate limters are added. So that the
controller won't be overwhelmed. Global rate limters should be enough,
as icmp works as control message.

Change-Id: I82152afa49857f8fe8bb94e4f79ca1aba761ebeb
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support

commit_message:
Add cookie infrastructure to Dragonflow

Add a cookie infrastructure that allows global and local cookies to be
allocated dynamically in dragonflow.

Global cookies are cross-system. (e.g. l3 and security groups use these
bits for the same thing)

Local cookie space can be reused by applications (e.g. l3 and security
groups can use the same bits for different things)

Change-Id: I0e2dcc24ead244762cb5e9f3c18ad5f48652f914
Related-Bug: #1471552

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if
you receive a YAML document from an untrusted source
such as the Internet. The function yaml.safe_load()
limits this ability to simple Python objects like
integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: Ib260be0cc604f2272e3c676930bcb307752e142b

commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I78fde872948d6838957e35765c3f182bd4b9b512

subject: Allow for combined vips
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-30 15:34:04.000000000', 'files': ['templates/service.j2'], 'message': "Allow for combined vips

The haproxy role currently has a guard that does not allow for both
the internal and external vip endpoints to be loaded into different
frontends should the vip already be known. However, in some cases,
like when the internal and external vips are the same, this guard can
cause an issues resulting in endpoints not being accessible internally
due to the default setting requiring SSL on the external VIP. This
allows the extenral and internal vips to coexist even if they're the
same IP when SSL is enabled.

Change-Id: I09791c3ca79af85144f4fe8fa7a73d257cf78962
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Allow for combined vips

The haproxy role currently has a guard that does not allow for both
the internal and external vip endpoints to be loaded into different
frontends should the vip already be known. However, in some cases,
like when the internal and external vips are the same, this guard can
cause an issues resulting in endpoints not being accessible internally
due to the default setting requiring SSL on the external VIP. This
allows the extenral and internal vips to coexist even if they're the
same IP when SSL is enabled.

Change-Id: I09791c3ca79af85144f4fe8fa7a73d257cf78962
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add tracepath commands to the gate

The tracepath command is sometimes missing from the gate image.
This PR simply makes sure that the packages for tracepath are
installed so that we get the needed data in the gate at all times.

Change-Id: Ia325b1386aec77d604145a82326dd1a6323f3812
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

commit_message:
Mock time.sleep in tests that sleep

Tests that retry or sleep take longer when running
unit tests suite, so, mock time.sleep to save time.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie2e790dc26015d57c84f5a6b9777ee060dc1b820

commit_message:
Fix test comment and remove extra parameter

Fixed the comment in the test to match exactly what's
being removed and what the expected result is.

Also, removed that extra '/' parameter which was causing
the assert to test at the wrong directory level.

Change-Id: I2f27f0d12c08375c61047a3f861c94a3dd3915c6

commit_message:
[1/11] Refactor test_volume file

Due to the situation, that we've already had more that 7000 lines of
code in this file and it contains different test cases, it is
reasonably to divide it into smaller files.

This patch includes test cases that are connected with:
1) Availability zone;
2) Policy

Change-Id: I69ef0601bceb857565f36907eb8811379a5bfb77

[{'number': 19, 'created': '2017-02-07 21:02:27.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bp/ibmsvciogrpselection-e607739b6f655a27.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/replication.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/ibm/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'message': 'Autoselection of IBM SVC/Storwize IO group

Currently in IBM storwize_SVC driver, user can specify only one IO
group per backend definition.  The user now may specify a
list of IO groups, and at the time of creating the volume, the driver
will select an IO group which has least number of volumes associated
with it. The change is backward compatible.
Please see blueprint for full details.

Implements: blueprint ibmsvciogrpselection
DocImpact
Change-Id: I4766fc03bdacdde5dd9cfd4899c6cc5c2aee0d00
'}]
commit_message:
Autoselection of IBM SVC/Storwize IO group

Currently in IBM storwize_SVC driver, user can specify only one IO
group per backend definition.  The user now may specify a
list of IO groups, and at the time of creating the volume, the driver
will select an IO group which has least number of volumes associated
with it. The change is backward compatible.
Please see blueprint for full details.

Implements: blueprint ibmsvciogrpselection
DocImpact
Change-Id: I4766fc03bdacdde5dd9cfd4899c6cc5c2aee0d00

commit_message:
Nosec audit url open issue from Bandit

In an effort to clean up Bandit issues, these instances of issue B310
from Bandit in reference to making sure url open is being used only for
permitted schemes can be nosec'd as they have been verified to allow
only permitted schemes.

Change-Id: I4c7faea40cae5b0875e703c0df7367da868e7c62

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Related-Bug: 1616913
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to decorators.idempotent_id

test.idempotent_id is being kept temporary to migrate
to new lib interface. Now idempotent_id is available as Tempest stable
interface decorators and all plugins tests using the old decorator
should be switched to new interface.

In future, Once all plugins are switched to new decorator Tempest
will remove the test.idempotent_id

Change-Id: I6e24344a809ef397a252fe1fb002b2cad10cd5ba
Related-Bug: 1616913

commit_message:
Mock client initializations for irmc and oneview

This fixes an irmc test and oneview mock that were causing timeouts
in unittests with driver-requirements installed, as they were trying
to establish a connection to oneview/irmc management controller.

Change-Id: I1c01e6744064e3f0b8ed8188fb5d5edf9f544682
Closes-Bug: #1663709

commit_message:
test_create_server_from_volume_snapshot: assert dict is not empty before accessing a key

Following the patch: If2a257b24f2d50a401d6804e983bcad55b5c89e8
In case the dict is empty i.e. there in not an attachment, it will
be helpful to check whether there is an attachment or not to prevent
error in L204.

Change-Id: Ib74472b3b147f34a63ac5988c7db97230a9f4803

subject: Remove $myip when unnecessary and use KUBE_NODE_IP
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-10 13:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/configure-etcd.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-kube-apiserver.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-kube-proxy-master.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/create-kube-namespace.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-network-service-client.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-kube-proxy-minion.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-network-service.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-kubelet-master.yaml', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/fragments/enable-kubelet-minion.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove $myip when unnecessary and use KUBE_NODE_IP

myip is defined almost in every fragment. It is unnecessary. We can use
KUBE_NODE_IP that is defined in HEAT. Also, if for some reason
KUBE_NODE_IP is empty, we use the failsafe like in make-cert fragment
where we curl metadata to make sure KUBE_NODE_IP is not empty.

Implements: blueprint coreos-best-pratice
Change-Id: I8597a5afa9b4bc7a5c740738303102e7b60ec63e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove $myip when unnecessary and use KUBE_NODE_IP

myip is defined almost in every fragment. It is unnecessary. We can use
KUBE_NODE_IP that is defined in HEAT. Also, if for some reason
KUBE_NODE_IP is empty, we use the failsafe like in make-cert fragment
where we curl metadata to make sure KUBE_NODE_IP is not empty.

Implements: blueprint coreos-best-pratice
Change-Id: I8597a5afa9b4bc7a5c740738303102e7b60ec63e

subject: Add mitmproxy for openstack/mitmstack
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-01 13:51:21.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add mitmproxy for openstack/mitmstack

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, see activities during last month[1] and releases[2]

- Is the library good code?

Yes, see building history[3] and test coverage[4]

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, it is py35 and py36 compatible[5]

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes, MIT[6]

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

No

- Is the function of this library already covered by other
libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related
dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes,
of course) Which?

Yes, mitmproxy[7] is used by openstack/mitmstack[8] for
intercepting, inspecting, modifying and replaying traffic flows.

[1]: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/pulse/monthly
[2]: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/releases
[3]: https://travis-ci.org/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/builds
[4]: https://codecov.io/gh/mitmproxy/mitmproxy
[5]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mitmproxy
[6]: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/blob/master/LICENSE
[7]: https://mitmproxy.org/
[8]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/MitmStack

Change-Id: I9893cb08019938e025b8e1c60dca6fbdb7e95ce2
'}]
commit_message:
Add mitmproxy for openstack/mitmstack

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, see activities during last month[1] and releases[2]

- Is the library good code?

Yes, see building history[3] and test coverage[4]

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes, it is py35 and py36 compatible[5]

- Is the library license compatible?

Yes, MIT[6]

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

No

- Is the function of this library already covered by other
libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related
dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes,
of course) Which?

Yes, mitmproxy[7] is used by openstack/mitmstack[8] for
intercepting, inspecting, modifying and replaying traffic flows.

[1]: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/pulse/monthly
[2]: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/releases
[3]: https://travis-ci.org/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/builds
[4]: https://codecov.io/gh/mitmproxy/mitmproxy
[5]: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mitmproxy
[6]: https://github.com/mitmproxy/mitmproxy/blob/master/LICENSE
[7]: https://mitmproxy.org/
[8]: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/MitmStack

Change-Id: I9893cb08019938e025b8e1c60dca6fbdb7e95ce2

In the context of device tagging, bugs have caused the tag attribute
to disappear starting with version 2.33 for block_devices and starting
with version 2.37 for network interfaces. In other words, block
devices could only be tagged in 2.32 and network interfaces between
2.32 and 2.36 inclusively.

This patch documents this behaviour in api-ref and introduces
microversion 2.42, which re-adds the tag in all the right places.

Change-Id: Ia0869dc6f7f5bd347ccbd0930d1d668d37695a22
Closes-bug: 1658571
Implements: blueprint fix-tag-attribute-disappearing
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tag attribute disappearing in 2.33 and 2.37

In the context of device tagging, bugs have caused the tag attribute
to disappear starting with version 2.33 for block_devices and starting
with version 2.37 for network interfaces. In other words, block
devices could only be tagged in 2.32 and network interfaces between
2.32 and 2.36 inclusively.

This patch documents this behaviour in api-ref and introduces
microversion 2.42, which re-adds the tag in all the right places.

Change-Id: Ia0869dc6f7f5bd347ccbd0930d1d668d37695a22
Closes-bug: 1658571
Implements: blueprint fix-tag-attribute-disappearing

commit_message:
[Tempest] Split up share migration tests to separate classes

All tempest tests that are located in single class always run
serially. And one of our classes that performs lots of different
share migration tests takes about 20 minutes. So, split them up
to separate classes to speed up test run.

Change-Id: I117484f56ef8de9b01db4818be0069e98b6c78fc
Closes-Bug: #1663574

subject: Enforce inclusion of pulic proxy methods in docs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-10 14:24:50.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/enforcer.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': "Enforce inclusion of pulic proxy methods in docs

Per the approach on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/428276/, and in
general even outside of that change, we should have more strict
enforcement on the inclusion of our public proxy APIs in the
documentation. This tool runs as a part of our doc build, via `tox -e
docs`, and collects all of the public proxy methods and then compares
that list to the list of methods that were produced by Sphinx.

For right now this will only output warnings, but we should eventually
turn on enforcer_warnings_as_errors in doc/source/conf.py so that we can
truly enforce these things. If you don't document something, it'll kill
the doc build and then kill the docs gate job, so undocumented code
won't be accepted. We'll need to leave it off for the time
being as we transition into it.

Change-Id: I96743de7e0790da98d758415e084a26a92aa3c70
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce inclusion of pulic proxy methods in docs

Per the approach on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/428276/, and in
general even outside of that change, we should have more strict
enforcement on the inclusion of our public proxy APIs in the
documentation. This tool runs as a part of our doc build, via `tox -e
docs`, and collects all of the public proxy methods and then compares
that list to the list of methods that were produced by Sphinx.

For right now this will only output warnings, but we should eventually
turn on enforcer_warnings_as_errors in doc/source/conf.py so that we can
truly enforce these things. If you don't document something, it'll kill
the doc build and then kill the docs gate job, so undocumented code
won't be accepted. We'll need to leave it off for the time
being as we transition into it.

Change-Id: I96743de7e0790da98d758415e084a26a92aa3c70

commit_message:
Fix object save after refresh failure

When we try to save() object after its refresh(), it leads to a
TypeError. Let's not keep track of changed fields in refresh(),
all fields are reloaded from database.

Closes-Bug: #1612666
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I0f47552c424973af3704903a52f98db819b18c3f

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 07:56:16.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I49007c51723bfbe7747bcc611ff669f3c7980a10
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due
to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5
is available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: I49007c51723bfbe7747bcc611ff669f3c7980a10

commit_message:
SNMP agent support for OOB inspection for iLO Drivers

This patch allows to get the disk size by OOB Inspection
using snmpv3 if RIBCL/RIS is unable to get it.

Closes-bug: 1609622

Change-Id: Ib315dabc50b1f0b627b69781ef1c14de0d5d972c

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-02-10 10:33:18.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1662615-hnas-snapshot-concurrency-2147159ea6b086c5.yaml', 'manila/share/drivers/hitachi/hnas/driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hitachi/hnas/test_driver.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/hitachi/hnas/test_ssh.py', 'manila/share/drivers/hitachi/hnas/ssh.py', 'manila/exception.py'], 'message': 'HNAS: Fix concurrency creating/deleting snapshots

When attempting to create or delete empty folders in HNAS,
respective to snapshot creation and deletion, there can
be context changes due to concurrent requests received by
HNAS.

The result of the failed command is an error that the
operation cannot be completed in the current filesystem if
the context change switched to another EVS. In case the
context switch changed only the filesystem within the same
EVS, the operation may be run in the wrong filesystem,

Change-Id: I3439f8ab2dd967a438eac575172e4b96e897b46c
'}]
commit_message:
HNAS: Fix concurrency creating/deleting snapshots

When attempting to create or delete empty folders in HNAS,
respective to snapshot creation and deletion, there can
be context changes due to concurrent requests received by
HNAS.

The result of the failed command is an error that the
operation cannot be completed in the current filesystem if
the context change switched to another EVS. In case the
context switch changed only the filesystem within the same
EVS, the operation may be run in the wrong filesystem,
although, those operations are harmless.

Closes-bug: #1662615
Change-Id: I3439f8ab2dd967a438eac575172e4b96e897b46c

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-03 14:09:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': "Catch error and log warning when not able to update mtimes

When we launch an instance, nova updates the mtime for the _base image
to let the image cache manager know the image is actively used.  This
can lead to unexpected I/O errors when launching a large amount of
instances at once coming from the same _base image.

This commit puts the execute call in a try, except block to catch
possible errors. It also logs a warning with the path and error message.
With this, at least once the update will succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1621818

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I2fd1700aa4563a906eb574cbbe16caa63abae0d6

(cherry picked from commit 53da313a86e81bf1df75119ca0e8f857e7b2909c)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch error and log warning when not able to update mtimes

When we launch an instance, nova updates the mtime for the _base image
to let the image cache manager know the image is actively used.  This
can lead to unexpected I/O errors when launching a large amount of
instances at once coming from the same _base image.

This commit puts the execute call in a try, except block to catch
possible errors. It also logs a warning with the path and error message.
With this, at least once the update will succeed.

Closes-Bug: #1621818

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I2fd1700aa4563a906eb574cbbe16caa63abae0d6
Signed-off-by: Joris S'heeren <joris.sheeren@combellgroup.com>
(cherry picked from commit 53da313a86e81bf1df75119ca0e8f857e7b2909c)

commit_message:
Remove most unsupported drivers

In accordance with ironic CI policies, this patch removesi some drivers
that are not tested on upstream or third-party CI
and for which maintainers have not communicated any plans
to have such testing.

This includes:
- virtualbox drivers
- seamicro drivers
- msftocs drivers

Change-Id: Ia3a7d798c877f4628946ee6c56d850b9847e6c3e
Closes-Bug: #1663018

commit_message:
No node interface settings for classic drivers

Classic drivers have their interfaces (except for
network and storage) pre-determined. Unlike dynamic
drivers, it is not possible to change these interfaces
for nodes with a classic driver. If that is attempted
(when creating or updating a node), an exception
MustBeNone is raised (and HTTP status 400 is returned).

So that we don't break existing ironic clusters that
have nodes with classic drivers and interfaces specified,
a warning is logged (instead of raising an exception)
when a TaskManager is created.

Change-Id: I290b10f735d0da9710d1ee3b50c3252f73956428
Partial-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
Fixed typo causing bug in openstack-hosts-setup

The '$' at the end of the dpkg-query command causes it to return 2,
which means python won't be installed even though it should be.

Change-Id: I3937448a419a1f2d6405952e1cd7a4002b8d09af

commit_message:
Update global-requirements for psutil to 3.2.2

In order to run monasca-agent in environments using the musl libc
such as Alpine Linux, we need psutil>=3.2.2 due to an issue in the
old release [1].

[1]: https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/issues/664

Change-Id: I76570d36648cde2838982542bc4fa2b65d12715f

commit_message:
libvirt: fix nova can't delete the instance with nvram

Currently libvirt needs a flag when deleting an VM with a nvram file,
without which nova can't delete an instance booted with UEFI. Add
deletion flag for NVRAM. Also add a test case.

Co-authored-by: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I46baa952b6c3a1a4c5cf2660931f317cafb5757d
Closes-Bug: #1567807
(cherry picked from commit 539d381434ccadcdc3f5d58c2705c35558a3a065)

subject: scheduler: Don't modify RequestSpec.numa_topology
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20040, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Compute CI', 'email': 'microsoft_nova_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_nova_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-30 10:23:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hardware.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/numa_topology_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_numa_topology_filters.py'], 'message': 'scheduler: Don't modify RequestSpec.numa_topology

The 'NUMATopologyFilter' makes a call to 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' in
order to determine whether an instance with a sample topology could fit
on a given host. This function is provided with an InstanceNUMATopology
object, which was extracted from the RequestSpec provided to the filter.
However, the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' call has the side effect of
modifying a couple of fields on this InstanceNUMATopology object, most
notably the pinning information, and these changes are then propagated
to subsequent calls of the filter. The reason for this propagation is
presumably Python's "call-by-object" model [1].

While this doesn't cause any issues currently, it is a latent bug that
has caused issues downstream. Resolve the issue by copying the entire
RequestSpec object, thus ensuring any changes to this or the contained
NUMA topology are not stored and cannot affect future calls to this or
other filters.

[1] https://jeffknupp.com/blog/2012/11/13/is-python-callbyvalue-or-callbyreference-neither/

Conflicts:
  The 'zip' function must be wrapped in a 'list' to resolve a latent
  Python 3 issue.

Change-Id: If26cbdd5189c53891554c8d128be9b90578616aa
Closes-Bug: #1655979
(cherry picked from commit bff2030ecea8a1d21e03c61a7ece02f40dc25c5d)
'}]
commit_message:
scheduler: Don't modify RequestSpec.numa_topology

The 'NUMATopologyFilter' makes a call to 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' in
order to determine whether an instance with a sample topology could fit
on a given host. This function is provided with an InstanceNUMATopology
object, which was extracted from the RequestSpec provided to the filter.
However, the 'numa_fit_instance_to_host' call has the side effect of
modifying a couple of fields on this InstanceNUMATopology object, most
notably the pinning information, and these changes are then propagated
to subsequent calls of the filter. The reason for this propagation is
presumably Python's "call-by-object" model [1].

While this doesn't cause any issues currently, it is a latent bug that
has caused issues downstream. Resolve the issue by copying the entire
RequestSpec object, thus ensuring any changes to this or the contained
NUMA topology are not stored and cannot affect future calls to this or
other filters.

[1] https://jeffknupp.com/blog/2012/11/13/is-python-callbyvalue-or-callbyreference-neither/

Conflicts:
  The 'zip' function must be wrapped in a 'list' to resolve a latent
  Python 3 issue.

Change-Id: If26cbdd5189c53891554c8d128be9b90578616aa
Closes-Bug: #1655979
(cherry picked from commit bff2030ecea8a1d21e03c61a7ece02f40dc25c5d)

subject: Fix TypeError in _update_from_compute_node race
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-31 10:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': "Fix TypeError in _update_from_compute_node race

A compute node record is created in the database from the
_init_compute_node method in the resource tracker in the
nova-compute service. It is created without the updated_at
or free_disk_gb fields being set.

Shortly after it's created, update_resource_stats() is called
on the scheduler report client which calls compute_node.save()
which calls the update_compute_node() method in the DB API which
*always* updates the updated_at field even if nothing else
was changed.

So at this point, we have a compute node with updated_at set
but not free_disk_gb. The free_disk_gb field gets set by the
_update_usage_from_instances() method in the resource tracker
and then that value is later saved off when the compute node
is updated in the database on a second call to the
update_resource_stats() method in the scheduler report client.
At that point the free_disk_gb field is set on the compute
node record.

There is a race in between the compute node create and initial
update but before free_disk_gb is set where the scheduler host
manager can be attempting to update the HostState object from
the same compute node when selecting host destinations during
a server build. If that picks up the compute node before its
free_disk_gb field is set it will result in a TypeError when
trying to multiply None * 1024.

Change 36a0ba9c8141b445f2c6bfc093fde4cc98d229b2 was an earlier
attempt at fixing this bug and shortened the race window but
didn't handle the problem where updated_at is set but free_disk_gb
is not yet.

This change builds on that by simply checking for the thing
the scheduler host manager actually cares about, which is the
free_disk_gb field.

Closes-Bug: #1654102
Closes-Bug: #1610679

(cherry-picked from 2f1245a56c238646a056a20caa543f2a254b83d7)
Change-Id: I37b75dabb3ea7ec2d5678550d9aff30b1a0c29e6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in _update_from_compute_node race

A compute node record is created in the database from the
_init_compute_node method in the resource tracker in the
nova-compute service. It is created without the updated_at
or free_disk_gb fields being set.

Shortly after it's created, update_resource_stats() is called
on the scheduler report client which calls compute_node.save()
which calls the update_compute_node() method in the DB API which
*always* updates the updated_at field even if nothing else
was changed.

So at this point, we have a compute node with updated_at set
but not free_disk_gb. The free_disk_gb field gets set by the
_update_usage_from_instances() method in the resource tracker
and then that value is later saved off when the compute node
is updated in the database on a second call to the
update_resource_stats() method in the scheduler report client.
At that point the free_disk_gb field is set on the compute
node record.

There is a race in between the compute node create and initial
update but before free_disk_gb is set where the scheduler host
manager can be attempting to update the HostState object from
the same compute node when selecting host destinations during
a server build. If that picks up the compute node before its
free_disk_gb field is set it will result in a TypeError when
trying to multiply None * 1024.

Change 36a0ba9c8141b445f2c6bfc093fde4cc98d229b2 was an earlier
attempt at fixing this bug and shortened the race window but
didn't handle the problem where updated_at is set but free_disk_gb
is not yet.

This change builds on that by simply checking for the thing
the scheduler host manager actually cares about, which is the
free_disk_gb field.

Closes-Bug: #1654102
Closes-Bug: #1610679

(cherry-picked from 2f1245a56c238646a056a20caa543f2a254b83d7)
Change-Id: I37b75dabb3ea7ec2d5678550d9aff30b1a0c29e6

commit_message:
Remove useless returns, modify code to use kwargs

There are return lines never being reached, they need to be cleaned.  Use
keyword arguments to be more pythonic, and reduce warnings from code
inspection.

subject: Set correct IP in node and node_private
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-27 01:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo.sh'], 'message': 'Set correct IP in node and node_private

When using --setup-nodepool-files for local CI multinode testing, the
/etc/nodepool/node and /etc/nodepool/node_private files should be
created for consistency with the files that are expected to exist.

We are also making use of these files in our networking setup for
multinode, so they should exist when trying to replicate those
envirionments.

Change-Id: Iebf0e855ecddcd9d544a9e264cafd6c2698bc8dd
'}]
commit_message:
Set correct IP in node and node_private

When using --setup-nodepool-files for local CI multinode testing, the
/etc/nodepool/node and /etc/nodepool/node_private files should be
created for consistency with the files that are expected to exist.

We are also making use of these files in our networking setup for
multinode, so they should exist when trying to replicate those
envirionments.

Change-Id: Iebf0e855ecddcd9d544a9e264cafd6c2698bc8dd

subject: libvirt: prepare domain XML update for serial ports
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 11303, 'name': 'Markus Zoeller (markus_z)', 'email': 'mzoeller@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'mzoeller'}, {'_account_id': 12299, 'name': 'Paweł Koniszewski', 'email': 'pawel.koniszewski@gmail.com', 'username': 'pawel.koniszewski'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20040, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Compute CI', 'email': 'microsoft_nova_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_nova_ci'}, {'_account_id': 21279, 'name': 'Patricia Domingues', 'email': 'patricia.domingues@canonical.com', 'username': 'patriciasd'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-03 10:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_migration.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: prepare domain XML update for serial ports

The serial console feature uses "ports" on a compute node to enable
a websocket connection. On a host, one port can only be used by one
single instance. If another instance gets live-migrated to that host,
an update of the ports in the domain XML is needed. Otherwise we will
get an exception from libvirt/qemu which states:

    Failed to bind socket: Cannot assign requested address

This change here *prepares* the update of the domain XML. Another change
is necessary which actually provides the ports to use for this update
function within the LibvirtLiveMigrateData object.

This change is a preparation for the fix of bug 1455252.

Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I531ec76bc82beaea89f3a94a72e8a75627a9aa23
(cherry picked from commit 6a85a9882276752b1937138442315bc987e578ca)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: prepare domain XML update for serial ports

The serial console feature uses "ports" on a compute node to enable
a websocket connection. On a host, one port can only be used by one
single instance. If another instance gets live-migrated to that host,
an update of the ports in the domain XML is needed. Otherwise we will
get an exception from libvirt/qemu which states:

    Failed to bind socket: Cannot assign requested address

This change here *prepares* the update of the domain XML. Another change
is necessary which actually provides the ports to use for this update
function within the LibvirtLiveMigrateData object.

This change is a preparation for the fix of bug 1455252.

Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I531ec76bc82beaea89f3a94a72e8a75627a9aa23
(cherry picked from commit 6a85a9882276752b1937138442315bc987e578ca)

commit_message:
libvirt: do not return serial address if disabled on destination

During live migration, the check on the destination host is returning
the address of serial proxy even if disabled. However, the absence of
this serial address is the signal the source node needs to know to
determine if the target node supports the serial console feature.
The absence of the serial_listen_addr is specified by the value None.
This makes it also necessary to *not* do a string conversion of None,
as this (maybe surprisingly) results in the string 'None'. The string
'None' however is *not* a valid serial_listen_addr value, as this
must be a valid IP address. The reason for this is, that this value
is used to update the domain XML of the libvirt guest.

This change is also a preparation for the fix of bug 1455252.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I01dc0424ea3cf5576ed9d2b49a7a3e458324fbe4
(cherry picked from commit e4ed3a3a741625df045c0589db85b5262064ef48)
